intro: Rhodiola wallichiana var. cholaensis, commonly known as the Chola rhodiola, is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often growing at elevations between 3,000 and 5,000 meters. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense mats in its native habitat. The species is noted for its adaptability to cold and arid conditions, making it a resilient plant in its ecological niche.
